attributes.action: UK Parliamentary Footage Law Licence: Repeal Broadcast Regulation
attributes.additional_details:
This was recently highlighted by several shows including, most notably, 'Last Week Tonight with John Oliver' (HBO). 

This prevents all satirical shows, one example of many being 'Have I Got News For You', broadcasting Parliamentary proceedings in the UK.
attributes.background: A condition to broadcast Parliamentary proceedings is that "no extracts of Parliamentary proceedings may be used in any light entertainment programme or in a programme of political satire". Parliament should repeal this condition in the name of transparency and encouragement of freedom of the press.
